data.title: Newly open help view tab won't scroll to the searched result
data.body:
When choosing a result from the Search Help dialog, it should open the Help view and scroll to the result.

It works fine if this Object's Help view is already open. But if that's not the case, it will open a new tab and scroll to the bottom of the view, rather than to the searched result.

data.title: Vector4 is not highlighted properly in code editor
data.body:
Vector4, unlike other Vector\* class in highlighted in grey, and not in green (as other build-ins) or blue (as Object inheriting classes).

![Preview of issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/11318682/cefe51fa-9064-11e5-97b5-00093fac57a9.png)

data.title: new ColorPicker
data.body:
These are the features i'm willing to implement. I'm open to suggestions of course.
- [x] Add a visual editor
- [x] Allow to use shaders in default theme.
- [x] Add presets buttons
- [x] Implement screen color picking

data.title: Improve demos code formatting and update to 2.0
data.body:
Fixes #2712.

The scripts were streamlined using more or less the following conventions:
- space after a comma in lists of arguments
- spaces around weak operators (+, -), no spaces around strong operators (*, /)
- spaces around comparison operators and compound assignment operators
- space after a comment start (#)
- removed trailing spaces or tabs, apart from those that delimit the function indentation level (those could be removed too but since they are added automatically by the editor when typing code, keeping them for now)
- function blocks separate by two newlines
- comment sentences start with an upper-case letter

The scene files were resaved with the (current) 2.0 format, and some scenes that were in XML format were converted to SCN, to be consistent across all demos.

data.title: Selection in Spatial View doesn't work with instanced objects/scenes
data.body: As in title, also new ALT + RMB selection menu doesn't work with 3D instanced objects/scenes for the same reason probably.

data.title: Better allign for Public Methods list in API doc
data.body:
Usually when we look for methods we tend to search them by name not their return datatype. I suggest change type of text alignment as on mock-up:
![doc_text_align](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6152134/11312499/bfe9bf4e-8fd6-11e5-8c8f-4ffc6fba5b3c.jpg)

data.title: Add more properties to AcceptDialog
data.body:
Add two properties to AcceptDialog:
- `text`, the message of dialog.
- `hide_on_ok`, if the dialog will automatically hide when the user press "Ok" button.

Fixes #2421.

data.title: Compile on OpenBSD
data.body: A few small changes neccessary to build Godot on OpenBSD.

Sync doc template with code
data.body: @Ovnuniarchos you might want to have a look at the diff to see what the "doctool" discards when updating the template.

data.title: Documented 2D collision shapes and their editors
data.body: Documented 2D collision shapes and their editors. (minus RayCast2D)

data.title: bug get_rotation on Vehiclebody
data.body:
get_rotation on VehicleBody return value only for 0 to Pi/4 (0 to 90 in deg) or for 0 to -Pi/4 (0 to -90 in deg) 
![rect2985](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15943158/11301513/cc3a4292-8fa8-11e5-9475-9733e8bd4517.png)

data.title: Contextual help hotkey does not work since script editor/help tab merger
data.body:
The contextual help that can be accessed via the Help::Contextual menu entry is still working, but the hotkey that was assigned (Shift + F1) is no longer working.

It was removed in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/081a236c6739e7f6d45731ec0c002d2269f2367b#diff-d0f2bd20931a3b06b3e10aa2df9eee87L342.
Now F1 is no longer used for the help window so it likely conflicted with the new F1 assignment for the 2D viewport, but we still need a replacement.

Also take into account the proposed fix in #2111 for the previous behaviour.

data.title: export on command line broken
data.body:
I can export fine through the editor interface, but when I try running

/path/to/godot.x11.tools.64 -export "Windows Desktop" -path /path/to/my/game

it shows me

"Error in Add rsrc Section : Error in open file."

the first time.  Every time after that, it segfaults.  I was only able to get it to reset to showing me the error without crashing by pulling new code and building again.  I've tried exporting to X11 and Windows, with the same result.

data.title: Fix help display
data.body:
Currently when opening the in-editor help, nothing is displayed. This change adds the vertical expand flag to display the help again.

Fixes #2832

data.title: Cleanup calls to _snprintf in ustring
data.body:
_Edit:_ Rebased to be simply a code cleanup, the bug itself was fixed already.

---

Was a regression from ddbf2ff.
This commit also introduce a "#define snprintf _snprintf", so the rest of the file was simplified to make use of this
instead of distinguishing between snprintf and _snprintf in the various functions.

data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#903

data.title: Compile issue in OS_X11::process_joysticks()
data.body:
With gcc 4.9.2 on the current HEAD:

```
platform/x11/os_x11.cpp: In member function 'void OS_X11::process_joysticks()':
platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:1835:35: error: 'errno' was not declared in this scope
   if (bytes == 0 || (bytes < 0 && errno != EAGAIN)) {
                                   ^
platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:1835:44: error: 'EAGAIN' was not declared in this scope
   if (bytes == 0 || (bytes < 0 && errno != EAGAIN)) {
                                            ^
```

data.title: Replay scene/project buttons does not change icon back when closing the game
data.body:
If you click Play Project or Play Scene they change to a "replay" icon. If you close the game it still keeps the "replay" icon. It only goes back to the "play" icon if the Stop button is pressed.

![2015-11-19_13-16-24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/11277331/4ba4f54a-8ecd-11e5-8b2c-c81a13224741.png)

data.title: Help tabs not showing anything

data.body: Related to #2786. I thought the context menus expected behaviour was to appear on mouse button released, but it should be actually on pressed...

Normal length normalized.

data.title: Fix terminal warnings when moving the FileSystem dock
data.body: Fixes the first issue of #2568.

data.title: Auto bracket completion is disabled when a new script is created
data.body:
Auto bracket completion enables the editor to add a right bracket automatically after a left bracket was typed. 

How to reproduce:
- Enable auto bracket completion in Settings/Editor Settings/TextEditor/Auto Brace Complete.
- Create a scene, add a root node (whatever you want)
- Create a new script on this node. Built-in or not built-in has no impact.
- Try to type a left bracket

Expected:
- A right bracket should appear next to the left bracket.

Workaround:
- In Settings/Editor Settings, disable TextEditor/Auto Brace Complete, then re-enable it immediately.
- Auto bracket completion now works.
- Every time a new script is created, this behaviour happens.

BY THE WAY, this functionality should be enabled by default. It is currently disabled by default.
